titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. William J. Owens, Indictment
CWG7349

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

body.p:
State of Kentucky, Fayette Circuit Court
Special Chancery of Criminal Term 1865, Nov 4th 1865.
Comth Kentucky Plaintiff
against } On Indictment
William Owens Defendant

The Commonwealth came by her Attorney and the Defendant appeared in proper person in open Court and plead guilty to the charge in the Indictment, and acknowledged himself indebted to the Commonwealth in the sum of $500.

Wherefore with the assent of the Attorney for Plaintiff, and with leave of the Court, it is adjudged that the Plaintiff recover of the Defendant the sum of Five hundred dollars and also her costs herein expended.
It is further ordered that a Capias Profine issue upon the foregoing Judgment.
A Copy -- Att Jno B Norton c f c c

Comth Kentucky
vs } Copy Judgt
Owens Wm J
